note.p: Birth: Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, England (11 January 1814)
Death: His house, 5 Park Square West, Regent's Park, London (30 December 1899)
Career: Professor of Anatomy and Surgery, Royal College of Surgeons of England; Assistant Surgeon and Warden, College of St Bartholomew's Hospital; Lecturer on Physiology, St Bartholomew's Hospital
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1905 vol 75 pp 136-140 signed by J H
References: Gudrun Richardson, 'A Norfolk Network within the Royal Society' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 27-39, plate
L S Jacyna, review of Shirley Roberts, Sir James Paget: the Rise of Clinical Surgery in NR 1992 vol 46 pp 326-327
Notes: Death date in Proc Roy Soc 1905 vol 75 listed as January, 1900
